name: Bleakley v. Greenhill Farms of Lower Merion, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Bleakley v. Greenhill Farms of Lower Merion

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Ghidsey, Musmanno, Jones and Cohen, JJ.
parties: Bleakley v. Greenhill Farms of Lower Merion, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The order appealed from is interlocutory and un-appealable. It does not adjudicate any matter in controversy but merely poses for submission to a jury, the question raised by the pleadings as to whether or not a partnership existed between the plaintiff and the defendants as averred by the complaint and denied by the answer.
Appeal dismissed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Jack Brian, with him Howard Richard and Berman dc. Richard, for appellants.
Joseph W. deFuria, with him deFuria, Larkin and deFuria, for appellee.

Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Ghidsey, Musmanno, Jones and Cohen, JJ.
Jack Brian, with him Howard Richard and Berman dc. Richard, for appellants.
Joseph W. deFuria, with him deFuria, Larkin and deFuria, for appellee.
March 17, 1958:
